conclusion: The problem involves finding the refractive index of the glass brick SMN.
The glass brick is an isosceles right triangle, so ∠MNS = 90°.
The refractive index of the hemispherical transparent medium is given as √2410/30.
The length of OC is 3R/4, and OC is perpendicular to MN.
Since OC is perpendicular to MN, ∠MOC = 90°.
The length of BO is R/4, and BO is perpendicular to MN.
Since BO is perpendicular to MN, ∠MON = 90°.
The length of MN is 2 × BO = R/2.
The refractive index of the glass brick SMN is given by MN/OC = (R/2)/(3R/4) = 2/3.
Therefore, the refractive index of the glass brick is 2/3.
